SENT.plain: Granulocytic sarcoma is an extramedullary localized tumoral lesion of myeloid precursors
It is composed of immature cells of the granulocytic series known to occur in patients with myelodysplastic syndrome, chronic myelogenous leukemia or acute myelogenous leukemia
We present a 29-year-old female who was admitted to hospital for lesions that appeared on the face, lips and nose, mimicking lepromatous leprosy
It should be kept in mind that granulocytic sarcoma may mimick lepromatous leprosy
